main event: A spot of light, greenish in color and about the size of a dime, moved at a constant speed in Fitchburg, Massachusetts on 20 March 1955. It did not give the impression of distinct shapes or substance.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by a ground visual source, specifically the Civilian Dir. Gardner Civ Def.
The object's movement was compared to the size of a dime held at arm's length, indicating a relatively small appearance from the observer's perspective.
The report suggests that the object was oval in shape and moved at a constant speed, resembling a probable meteor sighting.
The observation lasted 2-3 minutes, providing a relatively long duration for studying the object's behavior.
The conclusion drawn from the report was that it was probably a meteor.
sighted object: a spot of light, greenish in color
